content: New to the rust project, and looking for good introduction / first issues for the compiler. Any good places to start?
Thank you for the link, though, I was already reading through that, it's what pointed me here for questions like 'what would make a good first issue'.
Let me ping @DPC to see if he can find you an issue to work on.
Maybe https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/212497-t-compiler.2Fhelp-wanted/topic/welcome/near/179048493 has what you're looking for @Rune Tynan

One thing that's nice when starting out is to just get used to the tooling. Run the various x.py commands. Maybe even make a silly change that does println()! every time a struct is created (or whatever). Then build the compiler! https://rustc-dev-guide.rust-lang.org/building/how-to-build-and-run.html

I love the rustc-dev-guide. In addition, reading through the rustdoc pages for rustc is invaluable: https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/nightly-rustc/rustc_middle/
